caption: This video showcases the challenges animals face for survival in the mountainous regions of Earth. These animals need to overcome harsh environmental conditions, seek food, and protect themselves from predators. This includes herds of cattle, pandas, and bees. Highlights include: herds of cattle facing difficulties but helping each other to adapt to the mountainous environment. Male cattle in the herd may kill other cattle but also provide them with opportunities. Large animals find the mountainous environment challenging to navigate. Mother cattle face the problem of drying up and must leave the high mountain pastures as soon as possible. Summer is a real test for large animals' survival. In snow-covered valleys, animals can still survive. Pandas find it hard to live in mountainous environments but still manage to attract animals. They rely on honey to get energy. Honey in the mountainous environment is a precious food for pandas. Honey, rich in fat, can help pandas make more improvements in survival challenges. Honey, baked in rocks, becomes a snack for pandas. Stones in the mountainous environment pose a survival challenge for animals. The stones no longer rise but gradually disappear. Animals need to overcome harsh conditions and find new ways to survive.
